noun.description: The state of being exposed to contact with something.
examples: the dangers posed by exposure to asbestos

noun.description: The revelation of an identity or fact, especially one that is concealed or likely to arouse disapproval.
examples: she took her life for fear of exposure as a spy

noun.description: The action of exposing a photographic film to light or other radiation.
examples: a camera that would give a picture immediately after exposure
trial exposures made with a UV filter

noun.description: The direction in which a building faces; an outlook.
examples: the exposure is perfect—a gentle slope to the southwest

origin: Early 17th century: from expose, on the pattern of words such as enclosure.
